definition: to brave it out/to the bitter end
to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)
(equivalent to 的 as possessive particle)
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base

sentences.english: Did not believe that the defeat is rational. I will overcome a legend.
sentences.chinese: 我只要拼到底，不去相信失敗有理，我打下一個傳奇。

sentences.english: Third, we need to and li jia small blood to the bitter end, guess gu will jia a three grumble.
sentences.chinese: 賈三要和李小手血拼到底，猜猜姑將賈三數落一番。

definition: fight to the death/desperate struggle
(coll.) to fight to the death
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
to pledge one's life
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
lit. to break the cauldrons and sink the boats (idiom); fig. to cut off one's means of retreat/to burn one's boats
to succeed or die trying (idiom)
pinyin: bu4 cheng2 gong1 bian4 cheng2 ren2

definition: to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to hold on firmly/to cling (to a belief)/stubbornly
lit. fight with one's back to the river (idiom); fig. to fight to win or die
by brute strength/rashly and forcefully/bull-headed/to work tenaciously with no fear of hardship
to throw caution to the wind/to press one's luck/to go for broke
to concede/to admit defeat/to admit sth is wrong after insisting it is right
to burn both jade and common stone/to destroy indiscriminately (idiom)
lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
